status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

worklogs.comment:
BryanCutler opened a new pull request #3009: ARROW-3273: [Java] Fix checkstyle for Javadocs
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3009
 
 
   Enable checkstyle rules for Javadoc and apply fixes. Suppressing missing Javadocs for now because there are to many to add here. Also, changed the checkstyle DTD links to point to more official files located at checkstyle.org. This was done because to suppress a check with a specific message required an update to the suppress filter DTD.

----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

BryanCutler commented on a change in pull request #3009: ARROW-3273: [Java] Fix checkstyle for Javadocs URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3009#discussion_r235521795 ########## File path: java/adapter/jdbc/src/main/java/org/apache/arrow/adapter/jdbc/JdbcToArrow.java ########## @@ -34,10 +34,10 @@ /** * Utility class to convert JDBC objects to columnar Arrow format objects. - *

- * This utility uses following data mapping to map JDBC/SQL datatype to Arrow data types. - *

- * CHAR --> ArrowType.Utf8 + * + *

This utility uses following data mapping to map JDBC/SQL datatype to Arrow data types. Review comment: @jacques-n @siddharthteotia @icexelloss most of these changes seemed pretty standard. The paragraph tag was the only thing that might have some discussion. The rule is that the `

` tag be before the first word after any newlines, after the first paragraph. There are no other options to configure this, other than disabling, but it didn't seem like a big deal to me to follow this rule. ---------------------------------------------------------------- This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service. To respond to the message, please log on GitHub and use the URL above to go to the specific comment. For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at: users@infra.apache.org

icexelloss commented on a change in pull request #3009: ARROW-3273: [Java] Fix checkstyle for Javadocs URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3009#discussion_r235522881 ########## File path: java/adapter/jdbc/src/main/java/org/apache/arrow/adapter/jdbc/JdbcToArrow.java ########## @@ -34,10 +34,10 @@ /** * Utility class to convert JDBC objects to columnar Arrow format objects. - *

- * This utility uses following data mapping to map JDBC/SQL datatype to Arrow data types. - *

- * CHAR --> ArrowType.Utf8 + * + *

This utility uses following data mapping to map JDBC/SQL datatype to Arrow data types. Review comment: Personally I prefer the old style for readability - the misalignment bothers me a bit. I am slight +1 to disabling the

tag rule. ---------------------------------------------------------------- This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service. To respond to the message, please log on GitHub and use the URL above to go to the specific comment. For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at: users@infra.apache.org

icexelloss commented on a change in pull request #3009: ARROW-3273: [Java] Fix checkstyle for Javadocs
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3009#discussion_r235525102
 
 

 ##########
 File path: java/adapter/jdbc/src/test/java/org/apache/arrow/adapter/jdbc/AbstractJdbcToArrowTest.java
 ##########
 @@ -52,10 +52,10 @@ protected static Table getTable(String ymlFilePath, Class clss) throws IOExcepti
 
 
   /**
-   * This method creates Connection object and DB table and also populate data into table for test
+   * This method creates Connection object and DB table and also populate data into table for test.
    *
-   * @throws SQLException
-   * @throws ClassNotFoundException
+   * @throws SQLException on error
 
 Review comment:
   Having "on error" here seems a bit unnecessary/verbose. I am slight +1 to either allowing:
   
   ```
   @throws SQLException
   ```
   or just get rid of the throws tag.

BryanCutler commented on a change in pull request #3009: ARROW-3273: [Java] Fix checkstyle for Javadocs URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3009#discussion_r235532624 ########## File path: java/adapter/jdbc/src/main/java/org/apache/arrow/adapter/jdbc/JdbcToArrow.java ########## @@ -34,10 +34,10 @@ /** * Utility class to convert JDBC objects to columnar Arrow format objects. - *

- * This utility uses following data mapping to map JDBC/SQL datatype to Arrow data types. - *

- * CHAR --> ArrowType.Utf8 + * + *

This utility uses following data mapping to map JDBC/SQL datatype to Arrow data types. Review comment: I agree, it makes the code look a little misaligned but currently this is really inconsistent in our Javadocs. Sometimes there is no tag, sometimes 2 tags, etc. And if there are no tags, then the compiled Javadoc collapses to one paragraph. So it seemed best to keep it so that the compiled Javadocs end up consistent. We could always disable in the future and change the tags with a global search since they will be consistent. WDYT? ---------------------------------------------------------------- This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service. To respond to the message, please log on GitHub and use the URL above to go to the specific comment. For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at: users@infra.apache.org

BryanCutler commented on a change in pull request #3009: ARROW-3273: [Java] Fix checkstyle for Javadocs
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3009#discussion_r235533486
 
 

 ##########
 File path: java/adapter/jdbc/src/test/java/org/apache/arrow/adapter/jdbc/AbstractJdbcToArrowTest.java
 ##########
 @@ -52,10 +52,10 @@ protected static Table getTable(String ymlFilePath, Class clss) throws IOExcepti
 
 
   /**
-   * This method creates Connection object and DB table and also populate data into table for test
+   * This method creates Connection object and DB table and also populate data into table for test.
    *
-   * @throws SQLException
-   * @throws ClassNotFoundException
+   * @throws SQLException on error
 
 Review comment:
   Yeah, "on error" is a bad description but it would take to long to do it any better right now. I think this rule is mostly useful to force people to put meaningful descriptions, so I'd like to keep it.  Maybe we can improve the "on error" descriptions in the future?

----------------------------------------------------------------

icexelloss commented on a change in pull request #3009: ARROW-3273: [Java] Fix checkstyle for Javadocs URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3009#discussion_r235580170 ########## File path: java/adapter/jdbc/src/main/java/org/apache/arrow/adapter/jdbc/JdbcToArrow.java ########## @@ -34,10 +34,10 @@ /** * Utility class to convert JDBC objects to columnar Arrow format objects. - *

- * This utility uses following data mapping to map JDBC/SQL datatype to Arrow data types. - *

- * CHAR --> ArrowType.Utf8 + * + *

This utility uses following data mapping to map JDBC/SQL datatype to Arrow data types. Review comment: It seems there is an example here that allows

not followed by a word: http://checkstyle.sourceforge.net/config_javadoc.html#JavadocParagraph "In case of tagImmediatelyBeforeFirstWord set to false the following example will not have any violations:" ``` /** * Some Javadoc. * *

* Some Javadoc. * *

Some Javadoc. * *

* 

    * Some preformatted Javadoc.
    *
* */ ``` I didn't try it myself, but does that allows the javadoc before? ---------------------------------------------------------------- This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service. To respond to the message, please log on GitHub and use the URL above to go to the specific comment. For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at: users@infra.apache.org

BryanCutler commented on a change in pull request #3009: ARROW-3273: [Java] Fix checkstyle for Javadocs URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3009#discussion_r235586484 ########## File path: java/adapter/jdbc/src/main/java/org/apache/arrow/adapter/jdbc/JdbcToArrow.java ########## @@ -34,10 +34,10 @@ /** * Utility class to convert JDBC objects to columnar Arrow format objects. - *

- * This utility uses following data mapping to map JDBC/SQL datatype to Arrow data types. - *

- * CHAR --> ArrowType.Utf8 + * + *

This utility uses following data mapping to map JDBC/SQL datatype to Arrow data types. Review comment: Yeah, it's strange but that's not a valid property. I try it and get: ``` [ERROR] Failed to execute goal org.apache.maven.plugins:maven-checkstyle-plugin:2.17:check (validate) on project arrow-java-root: Failed during checkstyle configuration: cannot initialize module TreeWalker - Property 'tagImmediatelyBeforeFirstWord' in module JavadocParagraph does not exist, please check the documentation ``` And I tried `allowNewlineParagraph` which is a valid property that sounds like it might do this, but didn't seem to have any effect. I don't know, maybe a bug or issue with the checkstyle docs... ---------------------------------------------------------------- This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service. To respond to the message, please log on GitHub and use the URL above to go to the specific comment. For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at: users@infra.apache.org

I try it and get: ``` [ERROR] Failed to execute goal org.apache.maven.plugins:maven-checkstyle-plugin:2.17:check (validate) on project arrow-java-root: Failed during checkstyle configuration: cannot initialize module TreeWalker - Property 'tagImmediatelyBeforeFirstWord' in module JavadocParagraph does not exist, please check the documentation ``` And I tried `allowNewlineParagraph` which is a valid property that sounds like it might do this, but didn't seem to have any effect. I don't know, maybe a bug or issue with the checkstyle docs... ---------------------------------------------------------------- This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
